title: 112_hr1149
content: The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel as a type of cellulosic biofuel with specific criteria for its classification and greenhouse gas emissions. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes provisions for qualified algae-based biofuel production by taxpayers. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This involves qualified algae-based biofuel production by taxpayers, including the production and sale of algae-based biofuel mixtures for use as fuel in trade or business. The Clean Air Act now includes algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit. A qualified algae-based biofuel mixture is a blend of algae-based biofuel and gasoline or special fuel, sold or used by the producer. Algae-based biofuel is any liquid fuel produced from algal biomass meeting fuel registration requirements. The Clean Air Act now includes algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit. Algal organism is defined as a primarily aquatic organism, excluding low-proof alcohol. Amendments include adding "and algae-based" to the code. The Clean Air Act now includes algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit. Amendments involve adding "and algae-based" to the code for eligibility criteria. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include adding "and algae-based" to the eligibility criteria for cellulosic biofuel and algae-based biofuel plant property. The Internal Revenue Code amendments include adding "qualified algae-based biofuel plant property" as eligible for depreciation, used solely for algae-based biofuel production in the US, acquired after December 31, 2008. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code allow for the depreciation of "qualified algae-based biofuel plant property" acquired after December 31, 2008, and placed in service before January 1, 2013. Algae-based biofuel is defined as liquid fuel produced from algal organisms, including microalgae, blue-green algae, and seaweeds. Effective dates for the amendments apply to fuel produced after December 31, 2008. The amendments made after December 31, 2008, apply to cellulosic biofuel plant property purchased and placed in service.
